content.description: Nice east-facing dihedral at the upstream end; rap off slings to ledge start. Two bolts protect the center and gear above and below (drop a #5 at the top as you rap in).
content.protection: Single rack cams and nuts, slings, QDs, two bolts.
content.location: Rap east off bolted anchor with long slings. Look for the wide flake on the east side.

climbs.name: Apache Kid
climbs.fa: Weston Markham, Manny Rangel, Enrico Saladino

content.description: The route begins with five bolts, difficult face climbing leads to a wide crack that narrows and finally deposits you on easy climbing near the top.
content.location: Right most route on south facing wall (Big Green Tonto is around corner). First five bolts easily seen. Approach from top and rappel onto the ledge.

content.description: Sunny and above the creek make a lovely winter wall with a burbling (sometimes snarling) creek running all year-round. It is about 100' tall and easiest access is by rappel.
